[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Warehouse Management System (WMS) defines requirements for managing warehouse storage, truck loading/unloading, and inventory allocation.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: WMS supports automated location assignment, manual loading/unloading tracking, and employee supervision.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: WMS integrates with inventory management and logistics systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: WMS allows managers and employees to input item details, track inventory, and generate allocation lists.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: WMS supports barcode scanners and handheld inventory devices.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: WMS uses PostgreSQL, MongoDB, REST APIs, and OAuth 2.0.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: WMS secures data via TLS encryption and access control.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: WMS is optimized for high-volume inventory tracking.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: WMS manages truck loading/unloading, inventory allocation, and slot availability.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: WMS is configurable for different warehouse layouts.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: WMS connects with supplier databases, shipment tracking, and compliance systems.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: WMS automates inventory placement, truck loading, and warehouse slot management.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: WMS is designed for warehouse managers responsible for logistics, supervisors overseeing operations, and employees handling stock movements.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: WMS requires manual entry for item characteristics and truck assignments.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: WMS relies on accurate stock information and employee inputs.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Truck Loading: Process of allocating items for dispatch.
Truck Unloading: Process of storing received items.
Slot: A defined warehouse storage location.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall manage warehouse stock locations (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall track truck loading and unloading activities (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall automatically allocate storage locations for unloaded items (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall track item details and availability in real time (REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall manage truck loading by freeing assigned slots (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an interface for managing warehouse stock and truck scheduling.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall update inventory records within 2 seconds of data entry, ensuring real-time visibility for tracking stock movements and order fulfillment.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store warehouse slot allocations and item details.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall track truck loading and unloading records.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall ensure unique identification for warehouse slots and items.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with warehouse safety and logistics standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall maintain logs for inventory audits and compliance checks.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Unit and integration tests validate stock tracking, truck assignment, and warehouse slot allocation.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API documentation, and compliance guidelines.
[SEC] 5. References: Warehouse management standards, logistics guidelines, and inventory policies.
